intro: Tococa kuhlmannii, commonly known as the Amazonian bitter tea, is a climbing plant native to the rainforests of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. Its fruits are berries that contain seeds, and the plant is often found in humid, shaded environments. Due to its unique chemical composition, it has been studied for potential medicinal properties.
